para.text: are used in ModelMuse to represent spatially distributed data for each cell in MODFLOW or for each node or element in PHAST or SUTRA. Each data set represents a two-dimensional (2-D) or three-dimensional (3-D) array of values. 3-D data sets are defined for the entire extent of the model domain. 2-D data sets are defined for a top, front, or side projection of the model domain. If the number of rows, columns, or layers in the grid or mesh changes, the sizes of the data sets are also changed. (In SUTRA, all data sets are treated as having a single row and the number of columns is the number of nodes or elements in the top view of the model.)
In addition to the data sets required by MODFLOW, SUTRA, or PHAST, the user can create additional data sets. The user-defined data sets can be used in “
” to define the distribution of values in the data sets that are required by MODFLOW or PHAST. See "
for more information on data sets.
